intro: Tragacantha glycyphyllos, commonly known as the Astragalus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, followed by pods containing seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Tragacantha glycyphyllos is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
